page.title: 19SIBSEY CHURCH
page.content: On Thursday 4th of July 1985 Judy and Zoe went to Sibsey Church to see Rev Loakes. We asked him a few questions about the church. {The Church is a hundred and fifty one {years old. The Church has one hundred {and twenty five steps to the top. The {vicar started being a vicar in {1959. We asked the vicar what other {churches he looks after ? He said {Frithvile, New Bollingbroke and {Carrington and sometimes the {Methodist churches with whom we are {in partnership. {Rev. Loakes is paid by the Diocesan {Board of Finance and the Board of {Commisioners. His work includes desk {work, visiting people at home, {committees and school assemblies. {People of all ages go to the church. {20-50 people go to church on a Sunday. {There are about seven weddings a year.
